result.execSummary:
The defendant Kail R Weber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision from case 2012CF0727.

  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Straight Time. Commencing forthwith. Sentence credit of 64 Days were granted.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kail R Weber

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Kail R Weber in court, in custody, with Attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Repeater enhancer is stricken.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Weathers makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

75 DAYS STRAIGHT TIME  (CREDIT - 64 days)

COSTS:  $243.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision on 12CF727)

**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department**.
Dated 12/07/15, from Atty Weathers to Judge Carter, requesring to move 12/18 hearing to 12/14.
(Fax) Dated 11/27/15, from Atty Weathers to Judge Carter, equesting to reschedule hearing for 11/30/15 (Note: Atty Smith appeared).

Defendant Kail R Weber in court, in custody, with Attorney Joseph Smith, Jr. for Attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Smith requests an adjourned date on behalf of Attorney Weathers.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 09:30 am.

COURT ORDERED A $250.00 CASH BOND IN ADDITION TO A $750.00 SIGNATURE BOND.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

COURT ORDERED A $250.00 CASH BOND IN ADDITION TO A $750.00 SIGNATURE BOND.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Kail R Weber in court, in custody, with attorney Kelsey Morin.   Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears as friend of the court.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Defendant allowed a non collect call. 
  Hearing scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
